name: Local Landing Pages
author: Ross Chapman & Desiree Cox for Zendesk

sections.description: Local Landing pages allows you to redirect the user on their first site visit based on their browser’s default language. It uses the HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE header to determine your visitor’s language. The menu in Settings > Local Landing Pages allows you to specify the path to a landing page for any particular language.
sections.installation:
1. Upload plugin-name.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Add the paths to your local landing pages. Please note that all settings are updated automatically; there are no page loads.
  4. Profit!
sections.changelog:
0.5

  • May 23, 2011
  • Testing version complete. It now behaves roughly like a plugin. Yay.

short_description: Reads the user-agent's HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE value and loads a page with a slug named after the language code.
